frontend: Set VITE_MICROSOFT_CLIENT_ID and VITE_MICROSOFT_TENANT_ID with your Azure AD app registration values
Update VITE_AZURE_AI_SEARCH_ENDPOINT with your actual Azure AI Search service endpoint
Replace VITE_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and VITE_YAHOO_CLIENT_ID with actual values if using these providers
Frontend variables must be prefixed with VITE_ to be accessible in the client-side code
backend: Set AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET with your actual Azure AD app registration secret
Update MICROSOFT_REDIRECT_URI with your actual Azure Web App URL
Replace AZURE_AI_SEARCH_API_KEY with your actual Azure AI Search API key
Set JWT_SECRET to a strong, unique secret for production
Set BYPASS_AUTH to false for production environments
Set NODE_ENV to production for production environments
PORT should be 8080 for Azure Web Apps
Update SQL_PASSWORD with your actual database password
Ensure all Azure service keys and connection strings are kept secure
general: In Azure Web App, these variables should be set in Configuration > Application Settings
Never commit actual secrets to source control
Consider using Azure Key Vault for managing secrets in production
After updating these settings, restart your Azure Web App for changes to take effect
